Posted: February 5, 2016
												This is it. This is the moment your whole life has been leading up to. Weeks of training, months of dedicated work to get yourself into peak condition; all for this. Your brain goes into overdrive as you see the ball barrelling towards you. With a well-placed hit, you effortlessly send it flying to the other side of the field. Your teammate, seeing an opening, leaps toward the ball and continues to lead it towards the opposing team’s goal. Abandoning your position of defense, you begin a pursuit of your own; a pursuit of glory. Time itself seems to slow to a crawl as your comrade sends the ball skyward, right into position. But time is of the essence. and it’s not exactly on your side either. The countdown begins; 10, 9, 8, 7… With the last of your energy, you bound towards the ball at top speed. The odds may be against you, but damn the odds; you’re going for gold! With a graceful leap, you make a last ditch effort to score the winning goal. This’ll be a buzzer-beater to remember!You miss the ball completely.REVIEWRocket LeagueGENREPhysics-Based Car SoccerDeveloped by the up-and-coming game development studio, Psyonix; Rocket League is the far more famous sequel to the lesser-known Playstation Network classic, Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle-Cars. [Hopefully, I won’t have to say that again. Er, type that again.] In Rocket League, you assume control of a battle-car in what can only be assumed is the ‘Rocket League’; a high-octane, high speed, supersport with a high mortality rate. In reality, it's car soccer, but that’s not important; what is important is the fact that you’re a mother♥♥♥♥in’ battle-car playing supersonic future soccer. In this utopian society, Rocket League is a high-intensity sport adored by millions, but experienced only by the elite few. As it just so happens, the ‘elite few’ is actually the ‘not-so-elite you!' Train hard enough though, and you’ll master the wonky physics of car soccer, save so many shots that your teammates may as well just nail you to a cross and call you the son of God, and maybe even perform aerial maneuvers so sick the entire crowd goes home with leukemia! Only the strong will survive in the Rocket League!In theory, Rocket League is almost the quintessence of simplicity within game design. You can drive, drift, jump, and boost. In practice? Not so much. Driving is as straightforward as it comes, mind the fact that you can drive on walls. Drifting is sufficiently simple as well, you can powerslide and change which way you spin whilst mid-air. Jumping, however is where things get complicated. When you jump, you have a variety of options to choose from for your next move. For example: simply pressing the jump button will send you directly skyward, another press and you’ll perform a double-jump. Pressing any direction whilst jumping will send you tumbling in that direction, performing two of these ‘flip-jumps’ in succession will send you barreling in a direction of your choosing without the need for boost. Speaking of boosting; hoo boy. You can boost while driving to, well, boost your speed. Simple, yeah? If you reach maximum speed, hitting an opponent will reduce their car to a smoking pile of rubble. That’s ground-based boosting. Air-based boosting is a whole different ball-park. With a hop, skip, and/or a jump, a little angling, and fingers to press left mouse with; you’ll be able to use your boost to soar gracefully like an eagle! Or not, it takes some practice.So that's the basics of the controls, but what about the game itself? Well, as previously stated, Rocket League is car soccer; no, really. You're in a car, there's two teams and a ball, and the objective is to score the most goals within a five minute timeframe. That's, uh, that's it. Sort of.There's four primary game modes in Rocket League; Duel, Doubles, Standard, and Chaos. Simply put, these are just neat little names for 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, and 4v4. [Coolio, huh?] There's also ranked variants of all of these archetypes excluding chaos, as it’s, well, a bit chaotic. Occasionally, limited time game modes will appear. At the time of writing, the most recent mode was ‘Snow Day’; a Christmas themed variant featuring lower gravity and a puck rather than a ball. It was pretty neat.Y’know what else is neat? Customization. Y’know what Rocket League has a metric ♥♥♥♥-ton of? CUSTOMIZATION. From body to boost trail, hubcaps to hats, and everything inbetween; Rocket League offers the Cosmetic Junkie within all of us the good♥♥♥♥♥♥ the premium cut. Then again, maybe it's just me that's crazy for that stuff. That ♥♥♥♥♥ my bread’n’butter. I need help. Oh, and don't go worrying your pretty little head about not getting that super-special hat you wanted; Rocket League rewards players with cosmetics after every match regardless of performance.Help, by the by, is in ample supply! Striker, to goalie, learn to play on the fly! Sorry. What I mean to say is that Rocket League has a variety of training modes worn which to hone your skills. In addition to basic and advanced tutorials; there's striker, goalie, and aerial training, as well as basic sandbox mode. The game may be hard to master, but you can't say it doesn't help you along.Let's say you get cold feet though; let's say you're intimidated with the prospect of going straight to online and ballin’ it with someone from Bali. Well, reader, in that case; why not peruse the offline bot-match options? Firstly, there's exhibition mode; a standard bot mode where you make the rules and play at your of leisure. The AI scales in difficulty with 4 increments; Rookie, Pro, All-Star, and Unfair. Unfair is exclusive to exhibition mode, as it's an asymmetric hell-hole. [In a good way, trust me.]Should that not entice you, season mode awaits your beckon. In season mode, you create a team and duke it out in the Rocket League for chance at some good ol’ virtual glory! Simply choose what difficulty, how many players, what team, and how many weeks and bam; you're ready to go.The music’s pretty swanky too, if I do say so myself. [Which is kinda redundant if you think about it; I mean, is it possible to not say something as yourself? Anyway, tangents are pretty neato.] There’s  good tracks in there, a couple okay, but the only true atrocity is that it only plays on the main menu. I mean, yeah, you could always just find the OST on Youtube and play it in the background, but it seems like a smidge of an oversight to be honest.So that's Rocket League; the hip new rocket-sport that all the cool kids on the block have been spackin’ ‘bout! I've never fancied myself much a fan of sports, though I have been getting into football. [Not futbol, mind you.] But I digress, the point is; even if you don't much like sports, this could be the game for you. Simply put, if you're a fan of high-octane, easy to learn, hard to master, physics based, team-reliant, competitive gameplay; Rocket League will be a blast for ya’. It's been hours of fun between my friends and I, and I don't see the end anywhere nearby. Oh, and did I mention there was splitscreen co-op? ♥♥♥♥in' righteous, Psyonix.What did the well-informed consumer say after reading this review?“Well that really got the ball rolling!”

content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
												1 minute review: 


YouTube™ Video: 1 Minute Review of Rocket League 

			Views: 164		

			FULL LETS PLAY/REVIEW: http://youtu.be/i-y-LwmRTck One of steam's hottest new titles, but is it worth YOUR money? Find out in this quick video and like and subscribe for more quick reviews and lets...		

This game is SO much fun. You play as a rocket car which you can custom design via unlockable special effects and truck body parts. The goal of the game is oh so simple, get the ball in the other teams net but the gameplay and strategy on accomplishing this is where Rocket League becomes something truly special. Everything from the music, graphics and sound effects draws you into the gameplay and really puts you at center stage of all the action regardless of your skill level. The art style is right on the cusp of the so-called "Uncanny Valley" meaning everything looks just real enough to not look like a cartoon, but just cartoony enough to keep the ambience fun and light. If you can convince some friends to take the plunge with you, this game is exponentially more fun when you're playing with friends and the game DOES feature multiple split screen options so local multiplayer is not only possible, but comfortable. I was having connection issues when attempting to play online, so online play might be spotty, but the game is quite popular already and it's literally the first couple days of the game's release. Having said that this game is worth having just for the local play with friends alone and I can see this title being a huge hit for the Steambox release coming up soon. BUY THIS you wont be disappointed.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 20, 2016
												The very best time waster there is to relax and pump yourself up at the same time. When you want to have an adrenaline rush big enough to pump you up and have a great time, but small enough to keep you relaxed, this is the game. Unlike, say, CS:GO or StarCraft 2, Rocket League brings the best of both worlds: casual and competitive play, and blends the two together to give you the most fun possible. The skill cap in this game is incredibly high, and you can never stop learning and getting better. It's fun to play, it's fun to watch, and also it's fun to fool around in additional modes (currently there are basketball and hockey variations, along with Rocket Labs, game mode with custom, funnily twisted maps.) Oh, and did I mention how much fun it is to customize your car? It's crazy. Pick a model, paint it in different patterns, pick the wheels, boost pattern, add a hat, an antenna (or don't), and you can roll around in your awesome pirate- or Holy-Religion-Jesus-Something-themed vehicle.You can really feel the speed of your car, and the adrenaline kick is enough for a dopamine rush compared to getting high on chocolate-flavour after-workout pizza weed straight from the best weed plantation on the face of the earth.Buy it if you want to lose your 15 hours from your week, every week. If you only want to lose 5 minutes of your day, every day, still buy it, since this is the length of an average match. But be warned: you're going to quickly develop the "one more game" syndrome (if you haven't yet.) You have been warned.But seriously, buy it.

content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												Decided to try it out since it was a free weekend. I knew it would be good based on gameplay I'd seen and seeing the features it has. I was worried I'd get addicted, and I am. Bought it. Too late to turn back. Worth it.Visually, the game looks great. The particle effects, the stadiums, awesome job. You really get immersed into everything.The controls are very easy. Right now I'm using a mouse and keyboard. After a few hours straight of playing, my W, A, S, D fingers were sore (lots of movement in this game). I plan on trying the game out with a controller (which seems to be the popular way to go). Like other reviews say, it's a breeze to pick up but hard to master. But so far in only 3 hours of playing, I would say I can hold my own quite well. Been matched up against pros (there's ranks that will appear under names such as Rookie, Semi-Pro, Pro (I think it goes higher)) and I've been able to outmaneuver them. The game takes some patience. Setting up shots for your teammates, waiting for the right time to thrust in and hit the ball; not just driving crazy and hitting the ball just to hit it. If you're worried about how you play, there's tutorials and training you can go through. I haven't done any of that (I'd rather learn by diving straight into a match) and I turned out fine. But there's lots of help if you want to get better.As far as the DLC, I haven't bought any, but they look neat. The cosmetics and car types are very appealing and bring a fun element to the game. I have several thousand hours in TF2, so maybe I'm biased :P And you acquire some after matches, it's not like you have to go in and buy stuff, that's just the DLC that costs money. Everything else you get by playing the game, which I love.I highly recommend this game. You don't have to like cars or soccer to play this. It's just fun.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 5, 2015
												Never have I played a game with a skill cap so high and so much learning but so simplistic. Rocket league is just perfect in every way shape and form. There's something about it that makes me keep coming back for more every single day. The strive to be great at the game is so oddly compelling and truly satisfactory when you actually see yourself improving.Losing in this game doesn't hurt as bad as other games such as league/hearthstone. There is almost no luck in this game. You look at what you did wrong every time and start remembering. Predicting where the ball will go next and where you need to be next to get that shot or save.Playing together with friends in a party is probably the most fun I have ever had playing a game and with the new mutators/dlc this is only the beginning of the fun.This game will turn you into a teenage girl before a house party. You're going to go through so many different styles of dresses and the dlc only makes it worse. The endless combinations of cars/decals/paint/hats/trails is a lot of fun for finding what you like best. I personally suggest playing with all of the cars until you find your favorite. I use the Dominus from the Battlecars dlc and have never switched to another since.Bottom lineIf your looking for a game that has so much potential for your skill to grow, Love to play with friends or by yourself, and like to customize your playing experience, then do yourself a favor and buy this ♥♥♥♥ing masterpiece.

												After finally playing the game for enough time to write a review, here it goes. Rocket Leauge is a face paced soccer game in which you use rocket powered cars to get around. Not only is this game extremely fun for those who are just picking it up, but the game has depth. As you rise up in rank, your opponents get harder and harder, but at the same time you develop better habits and skills for ball handling, defense, and offense. This game is fun for all levels of play, and im still trying to get better. Lan partys have never been better than with this game, so do yourself a favor and pick up a couple of CD keys on♥♥♥♥♥for just over 10 dollars, and give them to your friends. This game is neverending fun.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 8, 2016
												This is my favorite game of the year 2015. Fun, addictive and skillbased. Best played with a controller IMO. Some people complain about a toxic community. I haven't encountered much of that but I rarely play ranked. As when playing any real life sport this game makes you feel that tension, hope to do better and small annoyance whenever your opposition outplays you. Still; 95% of all people I played against were good sports and took it with a smile whether winning or losing. I mostly played 3v3 and 4v4 and feel that there is where the game truly shines. When a team works together on positioning and helping eachother, complement eachother so to say, is where the game goes from good to the best sports-like game I've ever played. This game makes that football/soccer feeling more present than any Fifa game ever has so far. Hitboxes and physics are precise and a joy to behold when you interprete the ball's path and your angle on impact right. This is one of those games that set new standards IMO. Already to be considered a classic and a worthy one of that title. You owe it to yourself to try it to see what sport games can be like in the future. More precise, more tense, more fun, more sports. This is  a great game. Try it out! (and get a refund if it's not up your alley but atleast try it to see what it is).

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												Rocket League is an amazing game and if I have to be honest, probably the best multiplayer experience I have ever had. Bold claim indeed, but I can't think of a time when I haven't invested atleast up to 10 hours per week on it.Rocket League's gameplay on the surface is as simple and clear as it can get. You have a symmetrical field, two teams with 1-4 players on each side and a ball. Kick the ball into the enemies goal to win and that's the only objective. Literally RC car football. But once you get used to the bare mechanics of the game, Rocket League starts to unfold its brilliance. Not before long you'll end up denying boost spots so that your enemy can't get the valuable boosts, crashing into enemies to make them go boom or kick the goalie away, rotating your car midair to hit the ball precisely into a specific direction and changing/rotating positions with your team in order to keep your goal guarded and to lay pressure on the enemies one.  The game allows for very strategic play and feels truly awarding when you end up victorious in a close match that went into +10min overtime against an equally skilled enemy team.Rocket League offers a good amount of playlists and game modes. Casual modes for some fun time after a long day, Competitive modes where the game will rank you according to your skill and even Hockey/Basketball/Rumble mode to change it up from time to time. I think that the ranking system as of now (Nov 2016) works really well and manages to keep me motivated, striving for better rankings (Grand Champion, here I come). Hockey and Basketball modes aren't very populated though and it can take a minute or longer to find people.Servers work fine for the most part, however you'll occasionally experience rubberbanding and lag which can be excessive, even in Competitive mode which can sour your experience. These issues however I have mostly encountered in Casual modes.Rocket League offers a sizeable amount of customization options for your car, from different chassis to wheels, colours, flags, decals and boost trails. It allows for some really funny and great looking vehicles and the recently added crates offer another big pool of content to work with. My only complaint is that decals aren't universal except for a few and the colour pallete isn't as big as I hoped for.Technically, Rocket League shines. The game is not a benchmark title per se, but it runs extremely smooth with no spikes whatsoever and offers a good amount of graphical options. I couldn't test performance with other cards myself (mine is a GTX980 - game runs up to 270FPS) but my friend has issues running it on a 310m on low settings(+30 FPS, Aquadome and Neo Tokyo are unplayable) so people with such low hardware should consider this before purchase.The visual style is very colorful and crisp. Rocket League doesn't suffer from visibility issues (it used to when cars exploded but it has been fixed since) and screen shake can be disabled (which I recommend). You can switch between two types of cameras: One that shows you everything right ahead of your car and "Ballcam" which tracks ball movement. Second option can be confusing at first but it is essential to learn using it, which after a while becomes second nature once you have developed good spatial awareness. Big plus: the camera can also be customized to your liking.I have never played a Multiplayer game that was this much fun and addictive. I highly recommend it to everyone who is looking for a fun and competitively viable game.If you excuse me, I've got to pwn some noo...*gets hit by teammate*AAAAAIIIIIIMPOOOOOOT!!!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 10, 2015
												Believe the hype. Like many classics of their time, Counter-Strike, Quake... even Spacewar, this game's simplicity is its strength. Just basic gameplay with oodles of nuance.Yup... oodles.It also doesn't hurt that the developers are extremely engaged with the community. At least, it doesn't hurt since they're committed to not fiddling and tweaking and throwing in gimmicks to the core modes. Most choices are cosmetic and what counts is how you play. No pay to win! How about that?So hop in and bop the ball around with others at your skill level! And when you get up to the point where people are flying off the walls and knocking the ball into your goal from midair, rest assured it's not because they bought fancy gear or gained enough levels to give them perks. You can do it too, right from the start, even... with enough practice.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												Rocket League is a game with an exponentially high skill cap. Its gameplay can be loose and quirky, or tight and calculated, it all depends on how skilled the players involved are. You can laugh at your mistakes, or choose to take each one to heart, trying to improve upon your skills. Just remember in the end that while Rocket League can be frustrating at times, if you persevere you can gain consistency and improve your skill as long as you don't let your failures keep you from overcoming the same issue the next time. There are always new ways to play, and with each new one, occasionally bugs are added, but the dev team always works hard to keep the game as bug-free and entertaining to play as possible, and I think that's part of why the game is as popular as it is. Thanks goes out to everyone who keeps trying, and doesn't put down others for not knowing as much as they do. Because we all know at one point we were just as bad when we started playing, and encouragement keeps the community friendly and growing.

content:
Posted: October 27, 2015
												Haven't heard of this game? You're on the steam page, of course you have.Haven't got this game? Get it.Got the game? Get the DLC.Got the DLC? Get the other DLC's.Got all the DLC's? Get some crates. Trade up. Get your favourite items.Got everything? Watch some Rocket League tournaments, or even compete for yourself.Done all that? Your life is complete.On a slightly more serious note, this game has a lot of customisation and a surprisingly long learning curve, where you are still learning new things at 1000+ hours. There are tons of montages and videos with a good community (once you get past Challenger, anyway) and finding nice people is surprisingly easy.I also want to point out that this game will last a long time. I bought this game over a year ago, and I thought that I wouldn't play it for very long. Here I am, closing in on 1000 hours every day. This game is extremely in-depth, even with it's very flat-looking surface, so if you are worried about that, worry no more!

												I'm a 33-year-old man and I've been playing games since I can remember.It's been a long time since I remember playing a game where I'm totally addicted to it.Most games nowadays feel like chores to me, except maybe some Blizzard ones.Rocket League is an amazing game. content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
												Never was a fan of football, and I never will be. Hell, not just football, any sport that requires me to do stuff. Although, I am a fan of vehicles. Cars, specifically. I wouldn't mind playing this for the rest of my life. It has a good choice of cars, even better if you have DLC cars (gotta pay for them though). Awesome maps, and has a competitive part to it, where you can play ranked matches. It also has cross-platform multiplayer, which is something R* should do with GTA Online. You can play with your friends if they're on PS4 or X1 and you're on the master race. Valve should take a look at RL and see how servers should be. SERVERS THAT ACTUALLY WORK, UNLIKE IN CS WHERE EVERY SECOND MATCH EVERYONE'S PING IS 4000+. Oh, and I found out that you can have pre-mades on your team for ranked matches, which is very dope and you don't get matched against other pre-mades, which is not entirely fair. Overall, good game, would recommend.

content:
Posted: July 11, 2015
												First of all. If you head and check the negative reviews 9/10 of them will be complaining about the servers from the first few days of launch. The game has had over 10x the amount of players they expected from the Beta statistics. If you check their twitter you'll see they've been working their asses off, non-stop since launch to make sure the servers are better and faster. (Which they now are)I played the original game Super Acrobatic Rocket-Powered Battle-cars and loved it. It was a genius idea and very well executed. This game is a polished off and perfected version. The game is very simple and easy to learn, yet hard to master. I have to say, out of the past 5-6 years of PC gaming it is one of the most fun and enjoyable experiences I have had, even with how little I have played it as of yet. For £14.99 it is an absolute steal! It is fun offline and on, without a doubt.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2015
												The controls are easy. the mechanics are easy. The matches are quick but very intense. You'll learn fast that just because you can fly around the map at top speed with ease, that's not always the best approach. It's not the kind of game you'll sit and play for hours at a time, but its one you'll come back to over and over again. Each game takes only 5 minutes, the game is less than 1gig of HDD space, and it loads up quick. Girlfriend runs to the bathroom while you're watching netflix together? Load up Rocket League, play a match and by the time she gets back you're already done. Plus, you won. Achieve victory while others leave the room. Micro-accomplishments gained by tiny rocket cars on a soccer field. $20 seems a bit high priced, but you can always ask Steam for a refund :) A great pick-up-and-play game while taking a break from shooters and RPG's. I regret nothing about buying this title.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2015
												*Controller Intro*:I'm playing this game with a PS4 controller pluged in the PC ( it works natively on Windows, without using any programs ) and the game recognises the controller as the PS4 controller, giving me all the controls in pop-ups accurately. I was kinda amazed.Now for the gameplay.This is a fast and tactical game, despite all the chaos that will happen on the field.The controls are simple and easy to get used to just after a few games, but very hard to master.The goal of the game is to score a goal by wrestling with a GINORMOUS ball while fighting with your opponents and trying to coordinate with your team.The matches are fun and exciting, lasting from 6 to 10 minutes, depending on the amount of goals scored in the match.The customization is wild and rampart, with the cars having the same "stats", except the minor hitbox changes.There are several game-modes, and if you're familiar with the FIFA or Pro Evolution Soccer games, you will understand what they are.You have the Exhibition game mode where you play ONE match with your adjustable settings.You have the Season game mode consisting of multiple matches that follow a basic tournament format.And you have the Play Online mode (currently down on 7.7.15, the launch day) that has Unranked and Ranked game modes.If you are a fan of fun, this is a game for you.

Posted: July 7, 2015
												*Controller Intro*:I'm playing this game with a PS4 controller pluged in the PC ( it works natively on Windows, without using any programs ) and the game recognises the controller as the PS4 controller, giving me all the controls in pop-ups accurately. I was kinda amazed.Now for the gameplay.This is a fast and tactical game, despite all the chaos that will happen on the field.The controls are simple and easy to get used to just after a few games, but very hard to master.The goal of the game is to score a goal by wrestling with a GINORMOUS ball while fighting with your opponents and trying to coordinate with your team.The matches are fun and exciting, lasting from 6 to 10 minutes, depending on the amount of goals scored in the match.The customization is wild and rampart, with the cars having the same "stats", except the minor hitbox changes.There are several game-modes, and if you're familiar with the FIFA or Pro Evolution Soccer games, you will understand what they are.You have the Exhibition game mode where you play ONE match with your adjustable settings.You have the Season game mode consisting of multiple matches that follow a basic tournament format.And you have the Play Online mode (currently down on 7.7.15, the launch day) that has Unranked and Ranked game modes.If you are a fan of fun, this is a game for you.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 7, 2015
												Fantastic game with a lot of customization and stuff to do. Platformwise they cover everything with competitive matchmaking but also splitscreen with your friends, which on PC you don't see too often. The game is also on PS4 and there is crossplatform capabilities in place. I'm runningat least 60 fps when in a game of 4v4 with bots and almost everything maxed out at 1920x1200 on my 7950.If you play games like FIFA you're in for a surprise, no help with aiming or targeting, it's all physics based. It's fast, hard and incredibly satisfying.I played in the alpha and beta on PC and all I can say is that the developer, Psyonix, deserve your money.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 7, 2015
												Do you hate football? Have you always felt that footballers would be a more appealing bunch if they had a boost engine attached to them and could do flips and stuff? Well, worry no more, Rocket League is here.If you never played the original game, Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket Powered Battle Cars, then you completely missed out on one of the greatest hidden gems on the PS3. Rocket League is the sequel to that game- arcade football with RC cars. If that sounds simple, that's because it is. However, as many players of the original found out, it's deceptively simple. While the controls and the aim of the game are easy to pick up, there's definitely a big gap between a good player and a bad player; mastering the physics of the ball and your own car take a long time.Rocket League is a step up from the original in nearly every single way. The game looks gorgeous, has a great soundtrack and the customisable options are off the charts. Psyonix are fantastic, down-to-earth developers and really deserve to be supported for making such a love-letter to the community they've fostered and cherished over the years.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
												Rocket league is a game that provides a fun fast paced experience unlike any other game, you may hate sports games and you may hate car games but rocket league offers a very different experience with a big learning curve due to its particular style.You may be asking the big question, how is it different to any other sports game or experience? Well I'll tell you why,Rocket league offers a much different perspective on sports games, and I'm not just talking about the camera angle, size of the pitch etc.  even though they are factors, I'm talking about controls, what I mean by this is, take fifa for example, to pass the ball (For controller) Press A, most of the time that will mean the ball will pass to another player then that player has the ball, to shoot is B, the ball will cleanly come off the player and shoot in the direction of the goal with little aim required, when you are dribbling, the ball will stick to your feet until contact is applied. When you are playing rocket league that completely changes, if you want to pass you have to make it happen, if you want to shoot you have to do it yourself, there is not a button to do so, this means you have to utilise all your controls and you're physically doing absolutely everything in your power to make something happen.  This means there is so much room for diversity in gameplay and skill, so many skills that are vital to one's success, just because you know the most complex skill doesn't mean you have won, You must learn to adapt in different circumstances and understand the situation. Rocket league may seem very repetitive at a first glance playing a 5 minute game on practically the same field but thats where you are wrong, rocket league will make you come back wanting more and more and more. Rocket league is a game where even after 100s and 1000s of hours, you can still improve drastically, every hour being more rewarding and fun than the last, I am still amazed at how much more I can learn even after I have played for ages. This game is very fun and I can't stop playing, I would recommend this game to anyone and I believe regardless of your preference you should definetly give this game a go.Overall 9.5/10

content:
Posted: December 20, 2016
												Psyonix is an incredible company, and this game proved that more than enough!A very fun and addictive game, which may seem a bit gimmicky, but can be taken as seriously as any other game.Constantly updated with major patches, all for free, as well as DLC packs and cars for those that enjoy it, and user feedback is taken seriously with all the features and bug fixes they've added ever since release.Many complained about a CSGO-like crate system being added, but they even added an option to hide all crate drops, if you really don't want to get tempted into gambling at all.If you are not sure about whether to get this game due to its different nature, you will most likely not regret it. Even simply solo-queueing is a ton of fun (if you don't do competitive - lack of communication makes it very hard to get good without a premade team).

content:
Posted: August 6, 2015
												Hitting just the perfect balance of approachability, chaos, skill, and fun is not an easy achievement, however it is one that Rocket League seems to excel at in all forms. This sports game grabs you and takes you along for a hell of a ride that just about anybody can enjoy. Let me be clear, I am not a huge fan of sports games, they have just never been my thing. Nonetheless, Rocket League hits all the right benchmarks for it to be one of the breakout games of 2015. What makes Rocket League brilliant is its easy to pick up and play controls, lending itself to easy enjoyment for anybody, yet still maintaining a degree of difficulty to master the advanced maneuvers. It doesn't just stop there though, bringing customization, splitscreen, and game modes are just some of the things that Rocket League does right. The only thing that can possibly sully the games enjoyment are other players. This is a non-issue as there is a season mode with varying degrees of difficulty that you can play by yourself or with a buddy. From graphics to music, everything just works very well in Rocket League. It's game that needs to be experienced to truly understand and is worth every penny of its purchase.I made a video review to show off some of the features and gameplay of this game!


YouTube™ Video: Indie Game of the Week - Rocket League 

			Views: 94		

			Hitting just the perfect balance of approachability, chaos, skill, and fun is not an easy achievement, however it is one that Rocket League seems to excel at in all forms.		

I hope you enjoy!Martyr

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2015
												Not much of an review, just a warm recommendationstraight from my heart.---RECOMMENDATION---Rocket League is a football/soccer game,with Nitro-Cars.This is a football/racing game, where each team startsat their respective sides on the field, and the ballis dead dropped in the middle, and the goal,is obvious, scoring goals. Each round is set to5 minutes, if the score is set to draw at the endof the clock, you go to overtime, and the first teamto score wins.Might not sound that fun, neither thought I whenI first saw this game popping up at Steam.But when I started playing it, it was a whole differentthing. This game is freaking addictive, fun and competitive,and just blew me away.Rocket League is developed by Psyonix. Not the mostknown developer team, but they do have some experience,mainly developing Supersonic Acrobatic Rocket-Powered Battle-Carson Ps3 and Co-Developing Unreal Tournament 2004 with Epic Games.And that shows, as the core mechanics are tight and precise.The Nitro-cars can use boostersyou fill up by driving over glowing circles around the field,you can double-jump and do trick-shots, and it's sosatisfying to score goals, doing that one insane trick-jump thatjust manages to nudge that ball into the goal, then watch the gloryin replay. Teamplay is important in this game,having a team mate passing the ball just right so you canboost in and do a trick-jump and score.The game is also fair, as there's no bs perks or unlockableitems that can give you an advantage in the match.The unlockables are straight visual changes, as well as the cars youunlock throughout the game. So everyone is playing onequal terms, and it's skills and team play that will determinethe winner.You can either play against Bots in customs matches,or seasons mode where you'll play in a leaguespanning over a set number of weeks.The bots are pretty good at Pro difficulty.At rookie they're too easy and dumb, so playingat Pro is the sweet spot between useless andunfair.If you're after some more intellectual opponents,head over to the multiplayer.This game supports 2, 3 and 4 player split-screenfor playing with friends.If split-screen ain't your cup of tea, no problem,this game features Match Making and Dedicated Servers.Set up a private lobby with your friends or play againstrandom people. This game features 1vs1, 2vs2, 3vs3 and 4vs4matches.Currently this game has a pretty large player-base for an indie game,and that's thanks to Cross-Platform play between PC and Ps4.The graphics are splendid, colourful and visually exciting, so nothingto complain about here.I really don't have much of any complaints regarding this game,tho some might feel as there's little content in this game,with there only being one game modeand no performance-enchanting upgrades for your cars, but,in my opinion, that's what makes this game great, everyone isplaying on equal terms, and the core mechanics in my opinion,is so fun and addictive that it doesn't really need more gamemodes to satisfy me.If you're a person who appreciates these types of games, this onemight be perfect for you, either you just want to casually playalone or with friends, or take it up to a competitive level, this gamejust works, and will give me many many hours of funentertainment.I strongly recommend this game for anyone wanting to trysomething different and looking for either casual funor competitive play either against bots or online.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------For more reviews and recommendations, please visithttp://store.steampowered.com/curator/6966222-Bad-English-Game-Reviews/

content:
Posted: April 22, 2016
												If you like arcadey driving games, simple sports games, and playing against your friends, Rocket League could become your next online addiction. Essentially soccer with cars and a giant ball, this game has you drive around an enclosed arena, bumping into other players as you try to knock the ball into the goal. But in keeping with the arcade spirit, the physics are a bit on the unrealistic side, which is why your car can hop up and twist, you can drive up the sides of walls, and head-on crashes only cause you to bounce back (though, admittedly, the physics may be too unbelievable for those looking for a real athletic challenge). You also can play matches up to four-on-four, either online, via split-screen, or in a mix of the two, though the more populated matches tend to be a bit too chaotic. There's even an exhibition mode where you can play against the computer, and these matches also go up to four-on-four, though this gets old pretty quickly -- well, unless you customize your car with a pirate flag, purple boost smoke, and a sombrero. That's just funny.

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 9, 2015
												Rocket League is a football (soccer) game where your player is a RC car. The concept of the game is simple and very enjoyable. Even though they reccomend you to play with a controller, I found that the keyboard and mouse controls were easy to use so I did'nt bothered playing with a controller. There are ALOT of car customisation so you can make your own car look unique and unlock more items as you level up. Multiplayer is fun. There is a casual mode where you play for fun in 1v1 2v2 3v3 and 4v4. And if you are a competitive person there is a ranked mode where you can play 1v1 2v2 and 3v3. Single player consists of quickmatch with the A.I or local and a season mode. Season mode is well detailed, you can choose your team, how many players per team, how long the season will be and more. Also you can adjust difficulty as you play. There is something for everyone in this game. For a 21$ game it looks amazing the details on the grass and the environment is amazing and it runs smoothly. If you are looking for a fast paced arcade game or if you are a football (soccer) fan, I defenitly reccomend you to buy it!

content:
Posted: October 29, 2016
												Ti piacciono le macchine? Ti piace il calcio? Compra Rocket League.Un gioco davvero estremamente divertente, sia giocato con amici sia in singolo online. Non c'è molto da recensire, il gameplay è intuitivo e strutturato molto bene, sono presenti molte macchine (alcune a pagamento tramite dei DLC) oltre a diversi campi; disponibile anche la modalità Hockey su ghiaccio e Basketball. Si può giocare da un minimo di 1v1 ad un massimo di 4v4, sia competitivo sia for fun. La personalizzazione delle vetture è vastissima, cappellini, occhialini, scie di NOS, colori, bandierine e molto altro. Ho storto un po' il naso quando hanno introdotto le casse (1.49€ l'una) ma vabbè, resta comunque un titolo quasi perfetto.Io personalmente trovo Rocket League super competitivo, e come ogni gioco competitivo che si rispetti, partono santi ad ogni gol subito, specialmente se ci si ritrova in squadra gente che gioca totalmente a caso. Have fun!

content:
Posted: February 8, 2016
												So.... You control a car, your goal is to hit a soccer ball into the opponent's goal. Physics! It isn't just any car though, you can flip, use a nitrous boost. and while being on a team of up to 4 people you have a damn grand time setting up shots and delivering, what's more, matches are only 5 minutes long, (aside from the time spent watching goal replays and the countdown back to the game) so you can hop in, have a quick game, hop out, or even hop out mid game and join games in progress...It's not very easy to explain the thrill of this game, it's something that needs to be experienced first hand in order to understand fully, I definitely recommend this game for anyone who likes physic based games along with teamwork.

content:
Posted: February 14
												I've sunk many hours into this game and for the most part, I thought it was great. A year ago the game was great. Today, not so much, and today I would not recommend it to a friend? Why? Psyonix's servers have gone to♥♥♥♥♥♥ Rocket League is a fast action game where split second actions determine who wins and loses. This is a game that cannot be played with lag.A year ago everything ran smoothly. Today my friends and I are having significant difficulties with USE servers. It's to the point where the game is tremendously frustrating. On your screen you hit the ball left, but a second later you see you didn't in fact touch the ball at all. During off-peak hours the game is better (Sunday mornings, for example), but during most of the gameplay during the week I end up rage quitting over constant lag issues causing me to be an ineffective player. I am not enjoying the game anymore. My friends aren't enjoying the game anymore.I suppose Psyonix haven't been able to keep up with the growing popularity of the game and have let the quality of their servers slip. I would not recommend this game to a friend with their current service.

content:
Posted: July 6, 2016
I used to love this game and play it daily until the Neo-Tokyo patch, and here's why:I'm ranked Expert in this game currently, but am only really as good as most Veterans.I got my girlfriend the game in the summer sale, and play it with her on a smurf account that is ranked Pro, she is Semi-pro currently.Unfortunately matchmaking is so bad that we can't have a good game and she doesn't really get the opportunity to play with people of a similar skill level to the learn the game, as the big recent patch appears to have completely f*cked up matchmaking. We will join a usual 3v3, and will end up with a team that is Me (Pro), her (Semi-Pro) and a random (Veteran etc.) and then will be against a team with an Expert, or a Legend and an Expert, and even Rocketeer ranked people.Just now I was playing this with her with our team comp as Pro, Semi-Pro, and Veteran, against 3 Veterans. We were winning 3-0 as our teamwork was pretty good. One player leaves on the other team, and someone hiding his rank replaces him. This guy then proceeds to juggle the ball 3 times in the air before scoring and just generally being very skilled in the air, and then goes on to beat us 4-3 (all the while my girlfriend is still only just learning to hit off the wall and very occassionally has the guts to try an aerial). So thanks to matchmaking the opposition gets an insanely good player who carries them, and as such we lose the game.Now this is not just some system that recognises that I am very good for my smurf rank and so giving me decent competition. Even when I play on this main account (as I said earlier I am expert rank), I have very often been put against teams made up of semi-pros and pros while having veteran team mates, and the newbies have been absolutely slaughtered, making me feel extremely guilty that they have had to come against such an unfair team.All-in-all, if you are already experienced at this game, you will tend to have fun, maybe have some stupidly easy games thanks to poor matchmaking. If you are new to the game or looking to get it for the first time and will need to learn the ropes of wallcrawling, aerials etc. then just don't bother until matchmaking is fixed, as you will just get annihilated and frustrated that you aren't being given the chance to learn the game amongst people of a similar skill level.

content:
Posted: September 29, 2016
												Good, but very poor network optimizationThe game is fun, but playing online takes up more than 1 Mbps for only 1v1. This is VERY poor network optimization, as ideally every network update whould only have to send 12 floats + 1 boolean (49 or 97 bytes depending on the float precision, plus network buffers) per car, then another 12 floats for the ball itself, leading to a grand total of only 146 or 290 bytes for the cars and ball, for the data sent from the server to the client every update. I figure 20 every second should be plenty - thats only 2920 bytes or 5800 bytes a second - 23 Kbps or 46 Kbps. then you only need to send a 2-byte packet every time the state of a boost pad changes, and then a packet for chat every time a message is sent. You should EASILY be able to play online with only a 512 Kbps connection. But it struggles on a 3Mbps connection with 1 other person browsing the web. PLEASE OPTIMIZE NETWORK USAGE.

number of helpful: 10 of 17 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 22, 2015
												Rocket League is sports game with cars, but will you want to play it ?Rocket League is a very simple arcadey sports game. You control an RC car and you play football with other people. It's as simple as it sounds and some matches could become incredibly intense.Gameplay is simple. You control an RC car and you play football. You have a nitro button to go faster and a jump button to save or attack. It's really simple and you get used to it really fast, you won't have trouble at all.Graphic's are awesome. It has a lot of color, some of the arena's are awesome and look incredible and not to mention the car's. They all look awesome and you can customize them, like adding decals, hats and antenna's. Soundtrack is awesome and the sound design is awesome. Everything from the car sounds to the crowd cheering it's all amazing, all the little details are just awesome.When you play single player the AI is incredibly easy as they AI is incredibly stupid. The only hard thing is unfair mode where you can choose 1v2, 1v3 or 1v4 and all of the are really hard.You can play this game for 100 hours and not get sick of it. The game is incredibly fun. It's one of those games you can always play as a side game and you will always want to play one more match after you've played it.The game doesn't have many bugs. The only bad thing is sometimes the ping would rise to 300 even though my internet is fine.Rocket League is a incredibly fun game and without a doubt a must own for anyone. I had tons of fun playing it and I see myself playing more in the future. The game has tons of modes like 1v1 2v2 3v3 4v4 and the unfair mode mentioned earlier. If you have friends this game is also a really great game to play with them. Rocket League is one of my favorite games that came out in recent memory. It's a great little title and a must own for everyone. I give Rocket League 9.5/10

content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												Game is Great.  The EULA is stupid.  In this day and age the publishers that be think that template EULAs should be used on all platforms.Publishers,The EULA, that was added on 2016/09/08, states that I (the consumer) cannot use the license on more than one PC even though I own a license to use it on the PC platform. Compare section 2(1) against section 5.1.b.  In otherwords you are trying to make the license be bound to 1 computer.  Section 2(1) makes sense in that I have a license on/with a single platform.  But section 5.1.b does NOT make sense in this day and age.  Espectially when the distribution platform is Steam.  Steam controls/limits only 1 active/running game at a time. AND when the game is paired with Steam Cloud which easily migrates saves between one computer and another I cannot believe that you added section 5.1.b.*#2) is that a EULA was added POST-SALE. I was not presented with a EULA at the time of sale therefor one CANNOT be added after the fact especially when it bans my use of the software if I don't agree to the license. e.g. I should not be able to use the newly patched version but I should be able to use the version prior to the patch that added the EULA in-game. Also I have no recourse, on the Steam platform, to use the previous version that did not require the EULA. (Steam's backup system doesn't work like a traditional backup system.)#3) Also Psyonix in section 6(7) says they can decide if your account loses access to VC/VG with no mention of any recourse the consumer can take to refute the claim. e.g. they are the police, judge and executioner.#4) Lastly Psyonix is specifically removing a right Californian's have. See the bottom of section 8. Thus this cannot be good for the consumer if they are removing a consumer right.All in all this was a bad move by Psyonix. It is a bait and switch licensing in terms of #2. You cannot even exit the software without agreeing to the license (unless you use Task Manager. You cannot even use Windows' ALT-F4). That seems a bit illegal doesn't it?*Post updated on 2016/09/09 0207 because I re-read the EULA and it indeed says 'at the same time'  I swear it wasn't there the 1st time I read it.  I apologize.

content:
Posted: September 8, 2016
												Uninstalled.New EULA is a joke and ♥♥♥♥♥ all over us, introduced Microtransactions because they couldn't make any decent DLC. There's a huge stigma about microtransactions in games, especially in a game you paid for, it's understandable from a F2P game, they need some sort of income to keep the game free and to keep making content, But when a game you buy decides to pack up some little DLC's into various crates and gives you the chance at getting the particular DLC you want, that's dirty. What could've become more DLC is now locked behind a freemium gambling paywall, with the real DLC I could chose what I wanted and happily pay for it, now I'd have to buy a key, then use that key on a crate, and hope that I get the item I wanted, if not, I'd have to buy another key, potentially spending more money on useless items, than I would on an actual DLC pack I actually wanted, not fun.This game was fantastic, the graphics, the feel, the cross-platform, now it's just another soon-to-be F2P money ♥♥♥♥♥.To sum up the EULA, Psysonix has complete control over you, they can sell your data on, They can take the game away from you and deny you access for life if they see fit. I'm not even going to mention that they deny access to the game unless you agree to their new EULA... oops. ♥♥♥♥ you Psyonix.Absolutely Disgusted.EDIT: I made a few mistakes when reading the EULA, review has been changed, the game is still going in a bad direction though.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 11, 2016
												Rocket League is an interesting, I want to say rocket powered radio controlled vehicle, sports game. You, the player, are placed in control of a vehicle inside a large arena with either AI opponents or online through matchmaking publicly or privately. From there you either play one of three sports of hockey, basketball,  or the popular soccer matches. Throughout your match you gain rocket boosts to assist with speed, aerial maneuvers, or flat out blowing up your opponents to somehow score a point in their goals. This game has quickly gained a following and the more time you invest the more goodies you unlock to decorate your vehicles; whether they be paint, decals, rims, antennas, rocket effects or car bodies. Special vehicle bodies can also be purchased through the games microtransaction page.Pros:- The game does have an addicting play style to keep you coming back.- Large community so games are quickly formed.- Plenty of accessories to make your vehicle stand out.- Experience points can be earned offline and online.- Game offers its own voice chat, great for PC players.- Cross-platform between PC and Playstation Network.- Soundtrack is great if you're into more of techno, dubstep.Cons:- Matchmaking could use work, especially for new players being matched against pros/veterans.- Aerial maneuvers can be tricky to master.- When players do drop out of matches they receive no penalty. Sometimes it just sucks seeing your teammates give up.- Expect players to be ball hogs or just flat out not care where they hit the ball.- Blowing up opponents. (To me this feature is great for defensive reasons, but some players take it upon themselves to whine during the match to quit blowing them up. It's part of the game, get over it.)Rocket League is still a fun game with hours of game play to offer. Just keep in mind, it offers the online competitiveness so expect some players to play poorly, intense, or like complete jerks. Playing with friends will obviously alter all of that, though. I still recommend this title as I'm sure more updates are in the near future and maybe another sport will be introduced to the roster.

												Played this game for about two months now, and all I can say is I love it. No match is ever the same and there's a ton of different skill levels and ways to play. One thing that annoys me the most however, is the community. Out of EVERY game i've played Rocket League has by far the worst community for lower level players. It does get better the higher level you get and if you're able to get over it for a while, it's not THAT bad. Over all I highly recomend this game for anyone that's looking for a fun new type of mmo. I rate this game a respectable 6/10 for new players. Not that it means anything, it's just my personal rating.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 23, 2016
												It is definitely a fun game. A lot of fun, but it is also a simple game. There is certainly some skill involved in playing this and even though I thought soccer games wouldn't be my thing, this game is a lot of fun. Did I mention it being fun?But all that being said, it is a simple game. Yes, there is some skill involved and it reminds me a lot of playing billiard, as you need to understand basic geometry in order to be good at it. Hitting the ball in the right angle drives it towards the goal, or away from it. Of course unlike billiard, this is a bouncing moving thing, and you are not alone in your endeavor to drive the ball into the opponents goal, so it might not always work out as you imagined.The thing is, I can't imagine me playing this for long. Yeah, its fun while its new and as simplistic as it is, as high a skill ceiling I feel there is to it. I am sure you can get crazy good at this game, if you just try, but this also requires you to have a team you play with. Where you can actually communicate better than just using the inbuilt canned chat options, but via team speak to let other people know that you got the ball, and not have one of your team mates dive in and ruin the perfect shot, because they didn't see you lined up for it.On your own, its a lot like playing soccer with a bunch of friends, kicking the ball around and hoping something sticks. You get some amazing plays, depending on your skill level and theirs. You might even manage to do combination attacks, where instead of bouncing the ball you are bouncing a teammate (or enemy) into the ball to make the goal. You can get quite a speed boost from being hit by an ally.But alas, on your own, I can't imagine this game to hold my attention for long. It is definitely a good and fun game. Give it a try.

content:
Posted: July 7, 2016
												If you're like me and you hate sports (football especially), purely because of how its evolved from a semi-serious thing into a soap opera that takes place on a muddy field starring stuck up millionaires prancing about in short shorts, and you also happen to like video games that are more fleshed out than you think, then rocket league is for you.Granted, rocket league is aimed at everyone, even the people who hate football (or soccer, for you foreigners). At first glance, you may say "its just football with cars", but its so much more than that. Sure, it has the basic premise as football, but you cant fly through the air using supersized thrusters, while doing a pirouette and hit the ball in mid air into the goal in real life can you?Rocket league features a satisfying customisation option that allows you to change the look of your car (of which there's many). You can change the primary colour, secondary colour, decal, trims, type of coating, antenna topper and even have hats on the roof. Not to mention the generous variety of cars they give you right off the bat, all of which have their own separate decals.However, as much as I love a good customisation screen, the gameplay is where rocket league thrives. Its easy to pick up and start playing, but its extremely hard to master, and when you first enter the pitch, you may even find yourself scoring goals already. This isn't even half of the gameplay. Using your thrusters, you can pull of bafflingly graceful tricks such as aerial pirouettes, juggles and even mid air bicycle hits (if you know what you're doing). These skills will develop the more you play, and teaching yourself how to do aerials is half the fun.Rocket league also supplies you with the necessary modes to assist in practicing said skills. It has aerial training, striker training and goalkeeper training, and more, all of which come in several difficulties to truly push you.Rocket league has a separate mode for competitive play. This is different from the normal casual match, as you'll be ranked based on your performance. If you're familiar with CSGO's competitive mode, then you'll know the ins and outs already. The gist is, you play 10 matches, and based on your performance in said matches you'll be ranked. You'll also reap rewards at the end of the season, these include crowns, thruster trails among other things.There's also a seasons mode that's separate to the other modes, where you face off against bots in a season. These bots have a team name, some of which I found amusing, and also want the winning cup as much as you do. It was fun, but once I did it once, I didn't end up coming back to it. For beginners however, its a marvelous way to practice.I think that rocket league a special game, one that doesn't come around often, but when it does, it hits the stores hard. The DLC (that provides no advantage to buyers whatsoever) is something that I frown upon. Its mainly because I never like DLC, and think its just another money grabbing gag (I'm looking at you activision and EA), but its a great way to support psyonix and rocket league itself. Some of the skins in the DLC are quite nice too, with the same amount of detail that went into the originals. These usually come with cosmetics too, so you get a plentiful amount of loot for your money.All in all, I think rocket league should be something everyone should play at some point. It's an ingenious idea that blends two ridiculous ideas together and it somehow works. Buy it. Play it. Learn its ways. Enjoy it. It truly is something to behold, whether you play it with friends or you play it solo, its guaranteed to satisfy you.tl:dr football isn't good, footballs with cars is good. Buy rocket league.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												I'm here to tell you all about the positions in Rocket League.Striker:You're job is to score goals and keep the ball on the opponents side.But whatever you do, DON'T MISS A SHOT. You will be hated on until you want to uninstall. If you score a goal, hope you don't have that one guy who spams "What A Save" after every goal. You will get hate.MidField: Most People don't even know that this is a position. You're job is to keep the ball from going too far back. You want to try and set up your Strikers for goals.Unfortunately, the second you miss an Ariel or any hit, you're going to get hate.But it feels so good when you hit an Ariel. So keep calm and waste that boost.Goalie/Keeper:This is probably the most important positions in the game.You're job is to keep the ball out of your net and to clear it up to your midfielders.But be warned, the opponents, and sometimes your own team, will constantly run into you and get in your way.Missing a Save results in a goal and your opponents getting real mad at you. Oh, and don't be that guy who gets the best spawn and stays back. Just don't. Well, that's it. My review on Rocket League. Hopefully this boosts your interest in the game.-Frost.

												Amazing. I don't think I've ever written a review on Steam, and I rarely review anything. But Rocket League is SO. MUCH. FUN. I've never played anything like it before. Yeah, it's car soccer, but your car has all kinds of fancy ways to flip itself this way and that to hit the ball just right. You have so much control, and you pick up the controls fast. Also included are great training scenarios that hone specific skills.You can play unranked, ranked, mutators (gravity, ball size, speed, bounciness, soccer cube,, etc.), and seasonal ice car hockey. And co-op is awesome!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 5, 2016
												Bringing cars together with football is a great innovation and the devs have done a really good job with this game. I'm not really interested in car games or football games but it doesn't matter because this game is so fun. It's got fairly simple controls but actually getting good at this game requires time and skill which is great. You can customise your car in many ways and it’s just aesthetic so everyone is on a level playing field; no one gets a perk advantage or something. Cars and controls feel responsive (with a controller), physics and fluidity of the game seems really well done and polished. You can play 1v1 through to 4v4 and you can play with people from PlayStation too which is a really nice added bonus. It’s also got different game modes where you can just play for fun or take it more seriously in a ranked system where you get put into divisions depending on your skill level. Overall, there really is something for everyone in this game. Very fun and worth the money.

content:
Posted: January 17
												Rocket League is a very addictive game. I Regularly find myself saying 'One more game' 20 times in a row. I would certainly not say that's a bad thing. With it's high speed gaming and Steep learning curve it may not be for the slower of us, but this game has a *Mostly* welcoming community many of which will help new players. Although sometimes frustrating (Im talking about the goalpost physics of course) this game is very well made, rarely dropping below 60 Frames Per Second at any time, on any map. However i regularly hear of people complaining about the map 'Aquadome' and it's eyecandy causing lag, this has never affected me.Stunning graphics and physics that feel very real, Excluding the flying, jumping and flipping cars obviously, make Rocket League a lovely experience. As well as this cross platform play allows you to play with your console friends in private matches although i would love to see a cross platform trading and parties that allow you to seemlessly play with your buddies no matter the platform.Would highly recommend this game to anyone!

Posted: July 21, 2015
												I bought this game because my friends were all hyped about it. I bought it a few days after they did and I am not dissapointed. This game is extremely fun and has hours of competative soccer/car badassery. This game is so fun it makes losing almost an enjoyable experience.Pros: Great single player game play Easy to Party up with friends Fast match quesGreat game mechanics and physicsGreat for all age groupsCons:Takes about 5 to 10 games to get the hang of positioning, boosts, and so forthI wish there were more than 2 different camera angle optionsNo penalty for quitting a game           The games are 5 minutes and people quitting after being down 2 goals is way to commonNo different game modes (yet)ConclusionGreat game to buy. Its worth every penny. Its one of those games where soring an average goal makes you feel like a boss. Hopefully they add more game types and customizable features. This game exceeded my expectations and I hope that they capitalize on the potential this game has for future development.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
												I don't like football/soccer, or football/soccer games. I like Rocket League. I can see why people like football/soccer games; the team play, the atmosphere, the tactics and the fun. Rocket League takes these bits and adds Hotwheels cars instead of players. I love it, and my kids love it, which is a rare thing to achieve; to appeal equally to such different age groups. Add to that it is currently the only cross-platform game in the world, allowing PC player to play against/with console players, with no detriment to either formats. Mark my words, this game is incredibly good, and will go down in the annuls of history to be remembered for all time. In the dictionary, under the word "Addictive"(addicting is *not* a word FYI), there is a Rocket League screenshot of the ball exploding after a goal.

content:
Posted: April 8, 2016
												I honestly did not think I would like this game. It was pitched to me by a friend as a hybrid between an arcade car game and a soccer game, and my reaction was "WTF". But the combination actually works quite well.This game is especially fun when playing with friends. At first, you don't take the game seriously, and you have a great time joking around. Then you start acquiring skills and start taking the game seriously, appreciating each time you score an aerial goal and or make an epic save. It's one of those "easy to learn, hard to master" games.The game does have a few bugs here and there, and there are a few oddities as well in the general design. But as long as you have a few wacky friends to play with, this game will keep you busy at least 100 hours.

Posted: August 1, 2015
												I would like to start by saying I really think this game is awesome and pretty exciting to play.But the online play is sub par, and full of people leaving when they are losing. And there isn't really a ton of depth to the game that makes it worth $20. The SP is amazing and probably the best part of the game the AI is actually pretty good, but a competive game like this is always better when played with other people. Or at least it should be.I am also uncertain if the different car parts and types actually make a difference. There isn't any stats listed but certain cars feel faster then others.EDIT: After spending the evening playing it with some friends I have switch my recommendation to yes, however I still stand by what I say, this game needs more content and a better online system before I will say it was worth $20. And if you are tight on cash, I would pass on this buy.

content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												Rocket League is commonly referred to as soccer with cars, although it plays a lot more like hockey. The game will test your co-ordination, reaction, timing, and awareness like very few other games.The game plays best with a controller and has an extremely robust learning curve. From playing in the trenches with the rookies, learning to flip your car and hit the ball, to crawling along walls like a spider, hitting every aerial. The sense of pride and awe you feel when completing your first off-the-wall follow-through aerial is incredible. Playing with friends and forming a team is recommended as you learn each others' tendencies and the teamwork aspect of the game begins to shine. I recommend this game for anyone and everyone, young and old, sports fan or not. This game is exhilirating, challenging, and fun!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												With a total of over 600 hours played I thought it about time to write a review. While this is of course subjective based as is most reviews I hope it provides you with what you are looking for and helps you to decide if you will be purchasing this game.Common thought | Coming from mainly fps and mmo type genres I can't recall a time where I was ever interested in a sport based game in fact I dispised them. I had to be persuaded just like those I have had to persuade before they realise this is a great game that deserves a chance to prove itself. If you are like I was you have probably thrown this game out the window because you think it "looks boring" or "its just soccer with cars" and thats a shame and my goal is to help you reconsider.Match Length |Each match of Rocket League lasts 5 minutes (Custom games excluded). The match ends when the timer hits 0 and the ball hits the ground or a goal is scored. Game Modes | I will start by explaining the non-competitive (Unranked) game modes. I won't go in depth but hope to provide enough information so you get a rough idea of each one. At the time of writing this review there are 8 modes which include: Duel (1v1), Doubles (2v2), Standard (3v3), Chaos (4v4), Snow day (Ice field with a puck instead of a ball), Rocket Labs (Experimental wierd shaped maps), Hoops (Basketball court with the hoops elevated) and Rumble (A new game mode which gives players power ups every 10 seconds which can effect both the ball and other players).I personally prefer Duels and Doubles as they require more effort on my part. Standard is fine and is the most common in the pro scene however I am not a fan of that many cars on the field at one time and usually stay in goals to avoid the mayhem. 4v4 is just a cluster ♥♥♥♥ and I never play it. Snow day was fun for about 5 minutes but not something I will be going back to. Rocket Labs can be fun for some random games and provides variation from the standard maps. Hoops was also fun for about 5 minutes and I feel the court is to small and should be made larger or even the same size as the soccer field but that might come across as wierd since a basketball court is smaller then a soccer field... anyway I don't play it and won't play it again. Rumble suprised me actually. It's quite fun and its hard to predict what can happen. You opponant may shoot for goal but then the ball is frozen in mid air for a few seconds which is then saved followed by a punch which sends the ball to the other end. I will be going to Rumble when I want some variation to my game from time to time.Competitive |This is where the game gets fun however does have both pros and cons. The competitive (Ranked) game modes include Duel, Doubles, Standard and Solo Standard (3's but you queue by yourself). Ranks - A total of 10 matches are required before you will be placed into a rank. There are 4 tiers which include Prospect (Prospect 1,2,3 & Elite), Challenger (Challenger 1,2,3 & Elite), Star (Rising Star, Shooting Star, All Star & Super Star) Champion (Champion, Super Champion & Grand Champion) Each rank within a tier has 5 divisions. Once you have reached division 5 in that rank you then have a chance to move up 1 rank. PROS:1. Its hard! - Games that are easy are boring, Rocket League is a game that you progressively improve over time and there are always players at your level which means you don't always get owned. When you score a goal or win its satisfying. After 600 hours when I get a goal it still feels awesome. 2. Teamwork and Communication - Strategy is definitely something that will improve you game. Pulling off mad plays or passing at the right time then stepping our opponant to score a goal is cool as ♥♥♥♥!CONS:1. sometimes versing unfair opponants where you verse someone greatly better then yourself or a smurf which is incredibly irritating.2. The addition of the Wasteland and Tokyo maps in competitive play. I feel they shouldn't be included as the field is different then the rest of the standard maps. This means some people may get these maps more then others which I feel is unfair. Tokyo being in competitive takes it to another level. The map has elevated sides and is just rediculous. Wasteland and Tokyo should be in non competive only.Final Thought |Look the game isn't easy, it takes time to get good and a very long time to get great but don't automatically disregard the game as♥♥♥♥♥♥before you play it thats just being naive. I've read some of the negative comments on steam for Rocket League and they are a perfect example. I understand the game isn't for everyone but what I am saying is it is worth trying if you don't like it refund it. I could have continued this review and I am sure I could have written it better I haven't written many reviews. if I can update it I will later but I hope that this helps.
