2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 30, 2015
												Okay, this game, I can assure you that it's not for all. But for people who just want to have a little fun one late night can pick it up with a friend or two, and suddenly it's so much better. I'll point out a few pros and cons about it (that I know of, and personally think is good/bad) because a lot of people think this is the best♥♥♥♥♥♥ever. It is not. There are many games better than this. But anyway.. What this game has to offer is:- Good soundtrack. Of course not all the songs appeal to me, but most of them do, and you can just have them in the background while working on something else. IF you buy the soundtrack that is. Not all the songs are available though.- A lot of car customizations. Even without the very neat DLCs, you can still get exclusive holiday items, if you're up to farm them, which can be a little time consuming. But other than that, all the cars look good, and you can have a lot of cool and goofy styles, if that's your preference.- It's pretty-looking. Honestly, it's one of the prettiest games I've seen (imo), and I play it on the lowest of the lowest quality. I still see the beauty in the maps and how well done some of them are made.- It's fast paced. Now, some people aren't as good with fast paced games, which is why I'm mentioning it. I love me some fast games, but I'm not really sure if this is a pro or a con. It can be discussed.Now, because I've already given the pros, right up there.^ I dunno what else to put in. It's a fun game and a great experience with friends? idfkWell, the only cons I can think of right off the bat is:- The matchmaking system. Some would agree with me, some would be like "BUH SUM PPL HEF ROOKI/VETEREN FRENDS THO". Well y'know what? It's still trash. Honestly. I shouldn't be in a match versus a Veteran when I'm still a Pro. Same with Semi-pro honestly. Yes, the ranks doesn't mean too much, but it can get people on the nerves when they always get a bad team and the other team's much better. Etc. Etc.- It's a sports game. Even though it's not exactly like football (football with cars, wow) it's still football. For those who don't like sports game, or sports in general (except for e-sports) should avoid this. Unless you want to try out something new, that's up to you.- Hitting your own teammates. Yeahm you can hit your own teammates without any consequences, right? Except you can ♥♥♥♥ their position up and lose a point. That's just one example out of many. But I can see how it can be (a little bit) good too. You can hit your teammate in case they got no boost. But usually it just messes up their position.- Easy leveling up. Even though it might not seem like a big deal (levels don't matter) it messes up the matchmaking system, because some Pros and Veterans should play with a lower rank. Again, this can be discussed.Well, I dunno what else to add. For people who don't get the ranking system:- Rookie is the lowest rank, and the first one you'll get. (Level 1-9)- Semi-pro is a rank you get after reaching a certain level. (10-19)- Pro is another rank you'll get after reaching a certain level. (20-29)- Veteran is yet another rank you can get. (30-39)- I'm unsure of the rest of the ranks, but I'm sure there are at least two more. I'm terribly sorry!If I had to rate it though, it'd be 8.5/10. Yeah yeah, sue me, I'm just a human.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 29, 2016
A Brief Review of Rocket League: Rocket League is an incredibly fun game based in a future of extreme sport and rocket science!Players operate powerful, rocket powered beasts as they attempt to play a game of football!Games are fun, engaging and extremly enjoyable to play with others. There are many different game modes from 1v1, 2v2, 3v3 and 4v4 as well as other game mades which can apply insanly fun elements such as square footballs, lower gravity or even faster footballs.Apart from the gamemodes themeselves, players have the ability to customise their beastly cars in many different ways from body, wheels, rockets, devals, hats and antennas! The choices for customisation seem almost endless!The incorporation of DLC's also make Rocket League and fun and engaging experience for any player with added cars, maps and even more hats!All in all, for the small price of £15, Rocket League is an extremely fun game for anyone looking for a fun and entertaining experience to enjoy in their free time. This game will recieve 10/10 Mann points for its countless hours of enjoyment, gamemodes and vehicle customisation!

content:
Posted: July 1, 2016
												Played this game for about two months now, and all I can say is I love it. No match is ever the same and there's a ton of different skill levels and ways to play. One thing that annoys me the most however, is the community. Out of EVERY game i've played Rocket League has by far the worst community for lower level players. It's riddled with afk's, people who abandon matches when they're losing, and over all just REALLY toxic people. It does get better the higher level you get and if you're able to get over it for a while, it's not THAT bad. Over all I highly recomend this game for anyone that's looking for a fun new type of mmo. I rate this game a respectable 6/10 for new players. Not that it means anything, it's just my personal rating.

content:
Posted: April 26, 2016
												I don't like football/soccer, or football/soccer games. I like Rocket League. I can see why people like football/soccer games; the team play, the atmosphere, the tactics and the fun. Rocket League takes these bits and adds Hotwheels cars instead of players. I love it, and my kids love it, which is a rare thing to achieve; to appeal equally to such different age groups. Add to that it is currently the only cross-platform game in the world, allowing PC player to play against/with console players, with no detriment to either formats. Mark my words, this game is incredibly good, and will go down in the annuls of history to be remembered for all time. In the dictionary, under the word "Addictive"(addicting is *not* a word FYI), there is a Rocket League screenshot of the ball exploding after a goal.

content:
Posted: September 13, 2015
												I'm here to tell you all about the positions in Rocket League.Striker:You're job is to score goals and keep the ball on the opponents side.But whatever you do, DON'T MISS A SHOT. You will be hated on until you want to uninstall. If you score a goal, hope you don't have that one guy who spams "What A Save" after every goal. You will get hate.MidField: Most People don't even know that this is a position. You're job is to keep the ball from going too far back. You want to try and set up your Strikers for goals.Unfortunately, the second you miss an Ariel or any hit, you're going to get hate.But it feels so good when you hit an Ariel. So keep calm and waste that boost.Goalie/Keeper:This is probably the most important positions in the game.You're job is to keep the ball out of your net and to clear it up to your midfielders.But be warned, the opponents, and sometimes your own team, will constantly run into you and get in your way.Missing a Save results in a goal and your opponents getting real mad at you. Oh, and don't be that guy who gets the best spawn and stays back. Just don't. Well, that's it. My review on Rocket League. Hopefully this boosts your interest in the game.-Frost.

content:
Posted: July 30, 2015
												Fun and entertaining game, due to its simplicity and solid gameplay. Rocket League doesn't have power-ups or different tiers. Instead, every car has the same speed and abilities, making every match as fair as possible. Without fancy upgrades or items it all comes down to skill. Double-jumping at the right time to make that save; flipping your car mid-air to perform a perfect shot; activating boost to reach the ball before your opponent does. In a time where every game tries to be bigger and more over-the-top, it's a breath of fresh air to play something simple that is actually fun.Edit: Some days ago, the mutators-update was added. It's a free update which allows (not forces) players to modify game elements like gravity, ball size, bounciness, etcetera. It makes for both a hilarious and refreshing experience, while normal modes are still available. Free updates like this make Rocket League better than most AAA-titles, at only one-third of the price.

												11/10, this game will be the next E-Sport.Have you ever wanted to play soccer in a rocket powered car, while being able to floor it into the other team and blow them up? You are unable to stop playing this game.Matches are only 5 minutes, a little bit more if you hit overtime.Easy to learn, but difficult to master the harder techniques.Controls are easy, and intuitive.The super simple tutorial makes the super simple controls even easier.Community is awesome.Cons:It's slowly sucking away my soul.Every once in a while you get connected to an iffy server, but even then it's not too bad.

												A fun, high-speed soccer game you can play as casually or seriously as you want. Best played with friends, but also fun alone.
